jparsec.astronomy

Class CCDElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astronomy.CCDElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CCDElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to hold and to calculate the properties of a CCD camera or webcam. Calculations are based on theoretical statements, so the real life could be somewhat different. The CCD camera/webcam is supposed to be attached to a telescope instance, with the possible presence of an ocular between the telescope and the camera. If you want to make calculations for direct focus photography, just set the ocular to null in the telescope instance.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int binningFactor
      Binning factor, for example 2 for a 2x2 binning.
      float cameraPA
      Position angle (orientation) of the camera in radians, 0 by default.
      int chipSizeX
      Size of the chip in horizontal, in number of pixels.
      int chipSizeY
      Size of the chip in vertical, in number of pixels.
      java.lang.String name
      Name of the CCD.
      float pixelSizeX
      Size of a pixel in horizontal, in microns.
      float pixelSizeY
      Size of a pixel in vertical, in microns.

      • CCDElement

        public CCDElement(java.lang.String n,
          int csx,
          int csy,
          float psx,
          float psy,
          int binning)
        Creates a CCD object by giving the values of the fields.
        Parameters:
        n - Name of the camera.
        csx - Number of pixels in x.
        csy - Number of pixels in y.
        psx - Pixel size in x (microns).
        psy - Pixel size in y (microns).
        binning - Binning factor.
